title: High Energy Prices Likely to Mean Less Oil Demand This Year, OPEC Says
sub_head: Prices for a wide range of energy commodities have surged in recent months
body:
Soaring energy prices are likely to crimp demand for oil in some of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing economies this year, the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries said Thursday.
In a closely watched monthly market report, OPEC said global demand for oil would grow by 5.7 million barrels a day this year, 160,000 barrels a day less than it expected last month. The revision means the oil-producers group now expects demand for oil in 2021 to total 96.4 million barrels a day.
